name: TheAtlantic
text: "The Supreme Court has transformed constitutional provisions for fighting racial segregation into instruments that preserve it," @LeahLitman writes: https://t.co/abpXJt3FGt

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Trump campaign's “election-security operation” is a key element of the president's closing strategy—and its capacity to wreak havoc next week could be significant, @mckaycoppins writes. https://t.co/9m5hSiSsvl

name: TheAtlantic
text: Endings are seductive. They suggest order, and resolution, and relief. But they don’t always suggest the world as it is. @megangarber on the conundrum of “Election Night”: https://t.co/Ga7xzNM2ZJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: If Trump tries to steal the election, people will surely protest. But stopping a coup requires more strategy, @JudithShulevitz writes. https://t.co/1gre0OYfOJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: He’s assailed democratic norms, but the president is lauded in parts of Asia for his hawkishness toward China, @TMcLaughlin3 explains: https://t.co/IpBt4hamAG

name: TheAtlantic
text: A former Detroit cop makes a living on YouTube filming America's worst neighborhoods. @clickclaimprize reports: https://t.co/QVKfmmg969

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Ponyo." "Julie & Julia." "Unstoppable." "Addams Family Values." Everyone has their own list of "comfort movies," but @davidlsims turns to these 25 genre-spanning films again and again: https://t.co/DlLUOnnAVF
